pmp_api.pmp_client module¶

The Client object is one of two primary means for interacting directly with the PMP API. There are other classes and functions provided by the pmp_api package, but most functionality has been limited to the Client object described herein and the NavigableDoc class.

A Client object can make requests of PMP endpoints, it can request an access_token, and it follow navigation elements, including next, prev, first, and `last. Finally, the Client object can also navigate ‘forward’ and ‘back’, similar to a browser.

All results returned from PMP endpoints are returned as NavigableDoc objects, so the API for NavigableDoc is important to look at as well.

class pmp_api.pmp_client.Client(entry_point)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

The Client object is a high-level interface for requesting endpoints from the Public Media Platform API.

Client objects can requests endpoints and will automatically sign all API requests. In addition, the Client object has a number of helper methods, which should make browsing easier.

Usage:

>>> from pmp_api.pmp_client import Client
>>> client = Client("https://some-protected.api.com")

We must request a token and then can browse the endpoint:

>>> client.gain_access(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)
>>> client.get("https://some-protected.api.com/some-endpoint")
<Navigable doc: https://some-protected.api.com/some-endpoint>
>>> client.next()
<Navigable doc: https://some-protected.api.com/some-endpoint?NEXTPAGE>
back()[source]¶

Works like a browser’s back button. Does nothing if this is used before any pages have been requested

first()[source]¶

Requests the first page listed by navigation. If first is absent, it returns None.

forward()[source]¶

Works like a browser’s forward button. Does nothing if back has not been used.

gain_access(client_id, client_secret)[source]¶

Requests access for entry_point using provided authentication. Finds the urn urn:collectiondoc:form:issuetoken and requests a token using the protocol listed there.

get(endpoint)[source]¶

Returns NavigableDoc object obtained from requested endpoint.

Uses the connector object to issue signed requests Also, saves NavigableDoc object as document attribute.

Args:
endpoint – url endpoint requested.
home()[source]¶

Requests API home-doc entry_point and returns results.

last()[source]¶

Requests the last page listed by navigation. If last is absent, it returns None.

next()[source]¶

Requests the next page listed by navigation. If next is absent, it returns None.

prev()[source]¶

Requests the prev page listed by page navigation. If prev is absent, it returns None.

query(rel_type, params=None)[source]¶

Issues request for a query using urn with params to create a well-formed request.

Module contents¶

Application for interacting with the PMP API See PMP Docs for more information: https://github.com/publicmediaplatform/pmpdocs
